title: on me by sections 3 and 35 of the Road Traffic Act 1994 (No. 7 of 1994) and
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Traffic and
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Traffic and 

Parking) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road traffic (traffic parking) (amendment) regulation 2022

title: on me by sections 3 and 35 of the Road Traffic Act 1994 (No. 7 of 1994) and
heading: 2. The Road Traffic (Traffic and Parking) Regulations 1997 (S.I. No. 182
text_raw:
2. The Road Traffic (Traffic and Parking) Regulations 1997 (S.I. No. 182 

of 1997) are amended – 

(a) 

in Article 8, by the substitution of the following sub-article for 
sub-article (6): 

“(6) A driver of a vehicle approaching a zebra pedestrian 
crossing where traffic sign number RPC 001 (zebra pedestrian 
crossing) or traffic sign number RPC 001A (zebra pedestrian 
crossing without belisha beacons) is provided shall yield the 
right of way to any pedestrian who has commenced crossing the 
road at the crossing.”, 

(b) 

in Article 36(2)(h) – 

(i) 

by the insertion of the following subparagraph after 
subparagraph (i): 

“(ia) 
crossing without belisha beacons),”, and 

traffic sign number RPC 001A (zebra pedestrian 

(ii) 

in subparagraph (ii), by the insertion of “RPC 001A (zebra 
pedestrian crossing without belisha beacons), ” after “RPC 
001 (zebra pedestrian crossing),”, and 

(c) 

in Article 46 – 

(i) 

in sub-article (6) – 

(I) 

by the insertion of “or RPC 001A (zebra pedestrian 
crossing without belisha beacons)” after “RPC 001 
(zebra pedestrian crossing)”, and 

(II) by the insertion of “or RPC 001A” after “location of 

traffic sign number RPC 001”, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 18th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [517] 3 

(ii) 

in sub-article (7), by the insertion of “or RPC 001A (zebra 
pedestrian crossing without belisha beacons)” after “traffic 
sign number RPC 001 (zebra pedestrian crossing)”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 October, 2022. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [517]

title: on me by sections 3 and 35 of the Road Traffic Act 1994 (No. 7 of 1994) and
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the introduction of zebra pedestrian crossings 
without belisha beacons. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [517] 5
